Also, you can use Auto Mode in "good light conditions" and take good pictures.But if you want a fast camera, take good pictures in auto mode for all light conditions, take pictures whitout exesive configurations, you must buy other.Else, if you want take very good pictures whit very extra large zoom, and take control of all parameters of the camera, buy the SX30Is.Remenber: SX30IS IS NOT FOR BEGINERS! and that is all I can Say about this camera!----------Si tu quieres tomar fotos de "exelente calidad" a la mejor resolucion, entonces debes tener algo de experiencia configurando el ISO, la Apertura, el nivel de Flash y el balance de blancos en modo Manual, en el Modo P, en el modo Av o TV. (Hay que leerse el manual primero!!!). De otra forma, puedes tomar fotos "con calidad amateur", usando el modo automatico. Además, puedes usar el modo automatico en "muy buenas condiciones de luz" y tomar buenas fotos.Pero, si tu quieres una camara rápida, tomar buenas fotos en modo automatico para todas las condiciones de luz, tomar fotos sin demasiadas configuraciones, entonces comprate otra camara.Sino, si tu quieres tomar muy buenas fotos con un super zoom, y tomar el control de todos los parametros de la camara, comprate la SX30IS.Recuerda: SX30IS NO ES PARA PRINCIPIANTES!, y eso es todo lo que puedo decir sobre esta camara.

Reviews.Title: What a camera
Reviews.Author: George Pitard
Reviews.Content: It is good for the value Simple and user friendly. I do recommend it. Happy with all of the different attributes. Video work well clear HD quality. For the money it works well I own a Sony HDD handycam 30gig with 800X digital zoom to me it give a clear and more sharper photo and video.

Reviews.Title: doesn't get better for the price
Reviews.Author: mightyo
Reviews.Content: Had the camera for a little over a month, very easy to use, long battery life, amazing zoom capabilities, and captures clear videos(good sound also). There are a few features on the camera that is good for adding that unique creative feel (miniature mode). picture quality is very good, almost to a dslr quality.... All in all a great camera to fill in that gap between a point and shoot camera and dslr. You can't get a better camera for this price!

Reviews.Title: Exceeds My Expectations!
Reviews.Author: David S. McMeans
Reviews.Content: Great image quality, awesome stabilized video quality, great zoom, feature-rich, fairly easy to use, can't praise it enough.I'm impressed that the flash doesn't wash out people as is often the case with forward-firing point and shoots. There is some real magic going on inside this camera.It took me a long time to find the audio setting for playing back video. I thought at first maybe the camera doesn't record audio. But there are two openings just beneath the flash on the front that look like microphones, so I persisted. During video playback, scroll all the way to the right and click the up button. That seems to do it. I seem to have to do this every time I play a video. The audio level resets to zero. I don't mind this, but I think it's not intuitive.The articulating LCD doesn't allow you to tilt it up or down. You can just flip it around. Would be nice if you could tilt it up for shooting close to the ground.

Reviews.Title: Can't Beat the Zoom!
Reviews.Author: Steven T. Fink
Reviews.Content: Being a zoom junkie, I need big zoom to reach the animals I love to shoot (with camera).  That said, my brief testing has demonstrated that big zoom must be limited to optical zoom, unless you are using a tripod.  As I expected using digital zoom of any kind is nearly impossible when outside with a breeze blowing.I already have a Canon 7D and a Canon 100-400mm L lens and Canon 24-105mm L lens.  Therefore I have plenty of quality to begin with.  But there are times that lugging all that equipment is more then I wish to do, hence this camera.In my brief experience, the strengths of the camera are:1) Very good, if not outstanding, IS2) Has external flash capability, allowing my to use my Canon 580EX Speedlite flash3) Twist LCD screen, allowing several angles to shoot4) Can produce outstanding images if you use post processing.5) Very flexible for photographers who are willing to learn the many techniques available.Weaknesses:1) No RAW2) Typical small sensor too large DOF on shots.  P&S; cameras never give the pretty bokeh, or shallow DOF that DSLR camera give.3) Buried in menus for Sharpness/Contrast, etc. user controlTake a look at these shots using the external flash:NOTE: It looks like Amazon removes links so I'll add the images when I get a chance.  I'm on PBase (sfink16) if want to search for the SX30 gallery and images.I used a -2 sharpness due to some of the subjects were aged and/or have skin imperfections.  I also used a -1/3 EV as this value seemed to work well with the shots I took and this camera.  I also used a -1/3 flash EV.  Of course I post processed the shots using Adobe Camera RAW (yes you can use this for JPG shots too) and Adobe CS3.Here is a lovely shot taken in very low lighting with no flash allowed.  When I showed some of my DSLR members the shot, they thought it was taken with a DSLR camera:NOTE: It looks like Amazon removes links so I'll add the images when I get a chance.  I'm on PBase (sfink16) if want to search for the SX30 gallery and images.In summary, if you like a huge zoom and are willing to post edit shots, you'll love this camera and can GREAT shots.  If you only are willing to purchase a camera for casual shooting with NO post editing, then you should probably consider something else.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX30 IS
Reviews.Author: Betsy "bstibal"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  This is a replacement for my older Canon Powershot S5 IS (which also took excellent pictures or so I thought until I got this one).  I love it!!

Reviews.Title: SX 30 IS lenses
Reviews.Author: F. Martins "just retired"
Reviews.Content: I ordered the $39.99 lens and filter kit along with the camera purchase. Like many of the other comments, these 52mm accessories are not the fit for this camera as per Canon Customer service and technical support . You really have to force these on the camera. Canon says you must use 67mm filters and lenses and offers an adapter ring to mount on the front of the lens.

Reviews.Title: SX30IS is a great camera for a safari - animal shots
Reviews.Author: Eugene W. Weisbrod, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to go on a photo safari in Kenya.  It was a great choice.  With the lens capable of 24 to 840 mm equivalent zoom capability, I was able to get closer photos than people with Digital SLR's.  The colors are crisp and the added optical zoom of 4X, for a total zoom of 140X or a whopping 3360 mm, worked fairly well on some of those far-off leopards.  The modes are easy to select and the action mode worked well for shots from moving vehicles.  The built-in anti-shake technology worked great as I got jiggle-free shots even when I was holding the camera freehand at long zooms with people moving around in the vehicle.  As an all-around camera - I couldn't ask for more.  Be sure to purchase a second battery pack if you plan on taking a lot of shots, but the advertised battery life of around 300 shots was not far off.  1100 photos later I like the camera even better!

Reviews.Title: I feel like a professional!
Reviews.Author: Someone You Can Trust.
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. It was well worth my money and it works even greater than I thought it would. I looked at different camera for months and did some research on every camera I was considering. When I came across this camera I was happy to see all the great reviews it had. Well the more I found out about this camera, the more I liked it. It was at a great price and I couldn't find any other camera this great for this price.This camera never ceases to amaze me. Every time I use it I'm learning something new about the camera and what it can do. It simply amazes me and I feel like a professional carrying it around and taking amazing shots. It is the perfect size and the zoom is great. I really wish that it came with more instructions on how to use the different setting, but other than that I am very satisfied. It is very easy to figure out how to use all the settings and I would recommend this to anyone. Want to impress your friends with professional looking shots? Look no further than this camera.

Reviews.Title: JC
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!!  It takes great pictures and wonderful videos.  It not only makes great pictures and videos, but it is easy to use.  I would certainly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a really good camera.

Reviews.Title: TRAVEL BUDDY
Reviews.Author: D. Hughes "2WHEEL"
Reviews.Content: BOUGHT THIS CAMERA FOR MY CYCLE TOUR OF NEW ZEALAND..WILL POST REVIEW UPON RETURN...I HAVE USED IT CONSTANTLY SINCE GETTING IT AND EVEN USED IT AS BACKUP AND TO SHOOT VIDEO AT A WEDDING..SMALL AND EASY TO HANDLE..VIDEO IS GOOD WITH NO MOTOR NOISE..STAYS IN FOCUS WHEN ZOOMING...BATTERY LIFE IS NOT THE BEST SO BUY EXTRA BATTERIES..IMAGES ARE CRISP, COLOR IS GOOD..GOOD VALUE FOR THE $$$.

Reviews.Title: Great Birding Camera
Reviews.Author: Nighttea Jorge
Reviews.Content: The 840mm zoom gives you great reach for those tiny shy song birds that just refuse to land on bare branches. The light little compact allows you to move off the beaten track in search of the owner of that taunting bird call and the low light performance gets you that shot. If the hyperactive bird is behind too much foliage for a clean picture, there's always the very nice video fallback.The pros would likely consider it only as a back-up. Nobody brings along thousands of dollars of heavy equipment just on the off chance something interesting might turn up, but for the causal birder who wants evidence of their encounters, this is nice and quick. Add a Raynox DCR 150 - Converter and you can take great micro-shots, but that'll take some practice.Sometimes it's a chore to get the camera to focus on your small subject with noisy background, the same happens when the dragon fly is less than a meter away. The trick is to step back a little and zoom in, as the working distance for the 840mm zoom is 1.4m. Forget bird in flight unless it's just hanging in the sky. Buy a big memory card, always shoot in high-res, and buy at least 2 more batteries. It's a fun camera that's very forgiving and gives wonderful results. the new Canon SX40 HS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-inch Vari-Angle Wide LCD should be a nice upgrade.

Reviews.Title: One man's review
Reviews.Author: Robbin E. Babcock
Reviews.Content: I brought this model because I Wasserstein taking a Greek cruise and didn't want to lug my bigger one with all the lens around everyday. it wworked out well foe me. Iwas looking for a smaller carmera with a zoom lens, I found it.Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Has Potential But Poor Performance in Low Light and Zoom
Reviews.Author: N. Dave
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera that has potential to be very good for a person that does not want to take their DSLR. I own professional DSLR's from both Canon and Nikon and was looking for something that I can just grab that is lightweight for those occasions when lugging around the entire DSLR gear is not practical. I do like the form factor of this camera and weight. The balance seems right and controls are where they need to be. The camera performs admirably in outside conditions and normal conditions with subjects a few feet away. The problem comes in when you have low light conditions, backlit conditions and when you apply the 35x zoom. This is with a tripod to compensate for shake. The camera just does not produce crisp details and the photos do not have the color, depth and details I am used to even with my compact Leica camera. Also since the low light photos were less than optimal, I had to return the camera. Like I say in my title, this camera has potential and I hope they fix the issues thru a firmware update.

Reviews.Title: if only the pictures were as good as the features.....
Reviews.Author: t. calahan
Reviews.Content: i got this camera as my sweet 16 present. i researched cameras FOREVER to find the one i thought would be best. i found the sx30 and was really, really excited to get it. as soon as i opened it i started taking pictures, and my only reaction was "...huh." the pictures were not great. i kept chalking it up to bad lighting or my lack of photography experience or not knowing how to change the settings but the fact is, the pictures aren't anything special. they have no dimension or depth to them. they look totally flat. the auto focus is terrible....if you're trying to take a picture of something close, it WILL.NOT.FOCUS.CLEARLY. even in macro mode. the lowlight is TERRIBLE. the background of the pictures are always grainy and really bad looking. the artistic features are really, really nice though. i also like that it's a li-ion battery as opposed to AAs, which disappear in no time. the battery charges fast and lasts a looong time. it's pretty easy to navigate, but it's difficult to change iso settings and things like that. it also bugs me that it has no ability to swap out lenses or put lens hoods on. but i guess that's what i get for buying a digital disguised as an slr. it seems like it has oodles more features than any other camera i've used, but the image quality is just bugging me so much. good for amateur photographers, but if you're serious about photography you won't be happy with the images. if you're gonna invest big bucks for a camera, spend the extra couple hundred and buy almost any other camera but this one. i've seen people's iphones take clearer shots. i regret deciding on this model and having my parents pitch in so much for something so not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Clown1957 "lone wolf"
Reviews.Content: I check at retail stores and talked to salesmen and got their recommendations then checked on Amazon.com and found this camera and it was over $100 cheaper to buy it on Amazon. Great zoom lens and easy to use. I've taken lots of pictures already and enjoy the ease of using it. Amazon always ships quickly and never a problem to exchange items when not what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: JV
Reviews.Content: i bought this for my wife and she loves it! the pictures come out great and the zoom is awesome. the movie quality is very good too especially for a camera like this. the price was great couldnt beat and being a newer camera i was glad it could use the SDXC memory card format so we were able to get a 64GB memory stick instead of standard memory sticks that only go up to 32GB.

Reviews.Title: Smile
Reviews.Author: Texas Aggie
Reviews.Content: Canon has always been my choice for cameras.  This is another great Canon camera.  Pics and video are great.  No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.
Reviews.Author: P. Gaskins "Jim Gaskins"
Reviews.Content: This camera is all I hoped it would be.  Easy to use and takes great photos and great videos as well.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Rae J. Helms "RJH"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas gift for my teenage grand daughter. She is thrilled with it and takes it everywhere she goes. It didn't come with an instruction booklet, but luckily I have the exact same camera so I photocopied a copy for her.The camera wa shipped quickly and packed well.. Thanks so much to the seller!!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Tamara Hanger
Reviews.Content: I bought this a few years ago.  I find it very easy to use & really like the zoom.  It takes pretty good video also.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Works like a champ.  Seller sent me an extra battery charger, but it is for a different battery, so it's useless.  Not a problem, though, as I only need to charge one battery at a time.

Reviews.Title: Love my canon,
Reviews.Author: susie
Reviews.Content: Love everything about this camera, was kayaking this summer and our kayak flipped and the camera went under for about 5seconds while filming the incident of being thrown out of the canoe in the rapids and the camera dried out and was never sent in for repairs and stills works perfectly! And still takes greats pictures, love this camera

Reviews.Title: Read my comment
Reviews.Author: wildman
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and video. Unfortunately the smart phones are catching up to this quality so I would think twice about getting this.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom; needed repair, though
Reviews.Author: Michael Bowe
Reviews.Content: The super-duper 140x zoom had a problem: the lens was sticking upon the power-on sequence of extending beyond the camera body. We sent it to Canon for repair. After some hemmiong ans hawing, Canon finally fixed it under warranty. But it has never been quite the same (we sent it back after a first repair attempt): the viewfinder does not tell you the level of zoom anymore. Aside from that, it is a great camera. It is complcated, and the user's manual is not that great. It is also not really very intuitive, so I have not been able to do everything I'd like to do on a whim. For example, even the delayed shutter was a bit tough to figure out.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Brenda M.
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love this camera! I love to take pictures and have a good eye but I hate having to fiddle too much with a camera. This one is easy and takes awesome pictures!

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Chels
Reviews.Content: It arrived quick, and I love all of the modes. Awesome zoom lens, and video recorder. I am going to have tons of fun with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Beginner/Intermediate Camera
Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: I really dig this camera. It's definitely not top of the line, but it has some good features. Amazing zoom function, high iso settings with minimal limitations, great for manual shooting. All in all, a nice point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Could ask for a better replacement for my previous camera, which I loved!
Reviews.Author: Didi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera used, but "like new" (as described in the ad) from Pups Discount Electronics.  I researched this camera for a while, for it was to replace an earlier Canon model, which I had for years and thought it would never die.  A new one would've cost too much for me, so I 'nervously' considered purchasing a used one.  I couldn't be happier with my new (or rather used) Canon.  Not only did Pups Discount Electronics ship it promptly and well-protected, they threw-in an extra battery.  The packaging was like-new, and all the accessories and manuals were included.  The camera is indeed like new...no scratches, no marks.  It works beautifully, and it's user friendly.  The Canon lenses are the best, and this camera stands true to the brand.  I thank Pups Discount Electronics for their prompt, honest, & professional service.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: BobbyB
Reviews.Content: Unless you're into very serious photography, which I am not, and you need lots of expensive, interchangeable lenses, which I don't, there is nothing not to love about this camera.  It takes pictures that I have to dumb down anyway if I want to send them in email, and that are awesome.  The lens wonderful, the magnification, wide angle, image stabilization, and all the rest exceed anything I need.  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Its What I Expected
Reviews.Author: Ronald H.
Reviews.Content: I've only had the camera a short time but the largest problem for me is the lack of a printed manual.  A large amount of information is available online or on the disk provided, but these resources are not available when shooting photos.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures!
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: The digital camera I had when I was studying abroad ended up breaking on me.  Luckily, I was able to have this shipped to me in Jerusalem!  It takes beautiful pictures and is such a high quality camera!  I'm almost happy that my other camera broke so I could get this one.  Worth the price and it is very durable.  Super easy to use.  Love love love it.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for its price!!
Reviews.Author: Vinay Kumar A Makam
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for 2 years now; overall it is a very nice camera with good zooming facilities and good video quality.

Reviews.Title: Canon at it's finest
Reviews.Author: Felipe Bueno Barbosa
Reviews.Content: I know that this is not the latest release from Canon but I could argue that this camera is, at some circunstances, better than the new ones, in fact, if you use the common websites to compare camera quality, the SX30IS is only losing in comparison for, let's say, the SX40 because of it being a higher price and bigger body. The lens, the sensor, the wide angle and speed are better in the SX30IS in my humble oppinion.

Reviews.Title: awsome
Reviews.Author: stacy kendall
Reviews.Content: this camera is awsome i take it with me everywhere it is so easy to use and takes wonderful pictures

Reviews.Title: Extraordinary product
Reviews.Author: juan
Reviews.Content: I have been using the SX30 IS for almost 2 years. For me it has been a nice experience taking shots with this camera. I can see the difference with a previous canon I had (A620). The White balances is better and the definition improves as well. The Auto mode take great pictures even on dark places. It's only to know a little more on aperture and shutter speed settings to take more special ones. I have no complain so far, battery last more than average, flash is powerful. It is an extraordinary product

Reviews.Title: nice pictures
Reviews.Author: hubie
Reviews.Content: for amateurs great item ,don't forget to get yourself tri-pod (cheap one ,i got mine at target for 30$ unless u have hands made of steel trying to get good shot with big zoom)i like to take pictures at night so shutter speed is very helpfull u can get very good results shooting at night

Reviews.Title: Best christmas present.
Reviews.Author: stephen "I'm a fiddle player who loves good r...
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, Quality of the pictures are excellent, My daughter is so happy for a wonderful camera.She will be able to use this csmera in photography class at school mext semister.

Reviews.Title: Love my Camera!
Reviews.Author: Carmen McIntosh
Reviews.Content: I love my new  Canon SX30IS camera.  It is exactly as described and was shipped promptly andarrived intact.  I have given it a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Faltaron accesorios.
Reviews.Author: Claudio Coronado
Reviews.Content: The camera itself arrived in excellent condition and within the agreed time, but lacked some ancillary to a camera. Such as the lens cap and strap. In everything else is OK.

Reviews.Title: Camera Canon SX30IS
Reviews.Author: Lia Sandra F. Godoy "Lia Sandra"
Reviews.Content: The camera is amazing. Very light and easy to handle. The Adorama sent the machine ahead of time to answer my request and so I thank them immensely. The machine came well packaged. It was an excellent purchase.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've owned...
Reviews.Author: Fred Booth
Reviews.Content: I've owned several cameras, including film SLR's with changable lenses, and this one is by far the best I've owned.  Purchased to take photos of my grandkids playing soccer, and the close-ups are fantastic.  Also purchased the 32Gb SD card, which will hold over 8,000 photos at full resolution.-> Word of warning if you decide to purchase filters for this camera...MAKE SURE YOU PURCHASE THE 67mm FILTER LENSE ADAPTER!!  Many of the filter adapters advertized in the accessories portion are 57mm or less, claiming to be for the Powershot SX30is...THEY ARE NOT!!!  Learned the hard way.  Suspect they figure no one will return them so they get the money and you're stuck with something you can't use.But as far as the camera is concerned, highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera, Gets the Job Done
Reviews.Author: Christopher Alexander "Christopher Alexander"
Reviews.Content: I'm somewhat new to this whole digital camera scene, so perhaps mine isn't the review to base your purchase on. I take a lot of photos, however, mainly scenery, family, and pets.I've had this camera for 8 months, and for the most part, it does get the job done. The 'burst,' however (how quickly you can take one picture after shooting the first) is a bit slow. Even with a faster memory card, there is still a 3-5 second delay between shots.Also, the camera does not accommodate a cable, which means you have to take all pictures by pushing the button on the camera. This can be a problem for shots where you need greater stability (such as a close-up of a flower).As noted elserwhere on this site, the telephoto is a bit fickle, as it tries to determine what you're taking a picture of, even if it's wrong. I've tried photographing birds in flight, for example, and the camera gets nutty, not sure where to zero in on. Switching to P-mode is sometimes helpful, though for some reason, many of the photos come out blue.To get around some of these issues, I purchased a Lumix, but I found it less hands-friendly than this one. The Canon, for example, fits nicely in my hands; the lens cap comes off with ease; the view-finder/door in the back open easily; and viewing photos on the screen is quick/easy.The camera does attach easily to a tripod, which is a plus.The flash is manual, so it doesn't pop up automatically or by the push of a button.The lens is not interchangeable, but it does have good close-up and good telephoto (the video posted above really gives you a good feel for the ease and range of the lens).I'm basically pleased with this camera. I just wish it had faster 'burst' and the capacity to attach a cable. For basic photography, it's user-friendly and the photos turn out pretty good.I hope this helps some of you as you try to make a decision about your purchase.

Reviews.Title: Overall a nice camera
Reviews.Author: Cheryl R. Pullen "cheryl"
Reviews.Content: The optical zoom is great on this camera.  I think the design could have been better as far as the photo preview.  I find I am inadvertently pushing the button while trying to take photos.  This is my third canon camera and I find they are all a good quality.  I would recommend it.  I enjoy taking nature photos and the zoom really makes it easy to get close-ups of birds and animals that would otherwise be out of range.  You will see good quality up to about 70 times zoom on it.  After that, it gets a bit grainy.

Reviews.Title: Good Review
Reviews.Author: Daniela Bacconi
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera to take good pictures from my girls and family. I choose Canon SX30IS because of its Image Stabilized as I have a hands shaking problem. It REALLY works good. I also LOVED the HD movies shot.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: lacatira
Reviews.Content: I decided to take picture-taking to the next level & this is the perfect camera for that.  I upgraded from a Canon Powershot A590 to this model and I simply love it!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: James Henderson "jamesh38"
Reviews.Content: Great starter camera, I am really learning a lot about taking pictures. It takes fantastic pictures and is tops in quality. Everything was delivered well in time for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous
Reviews.Author: A. Antoine
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera since January of this year and I absolutely love it. Takes fabulous pictures even if you don't know how to use a camera other than pushing the shutter button!Only thing I think is funny is I bought the camera for $369 through Amazon, not a daily deal but still $90 cheaper than it is today. Oh how prices change around the holidays! If you are looking into purchasing this camera, maybe wait a few months to see if the price drops? Just some advice :)

Reviews.Title: cannon Camera
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the camera. Not hard to use. But when zoomed out long distant you need to use a tripod.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Deysi
Reviews.Content: I'm in love my new camera. It arrived very fast. The vendor is responsible and reliable. I Strongly recommend !!!

Reviews.Title: love my new camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Zernicke
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip to Washington state in November. With the help of the zoom lense I was able to take photos of distant mountains and zoom in close on mid distance subjects. I never had to use a flash even while indoors and at a few museums that don't allow flash photography. That really impressed me. My main reason I chose this camera over other ultra zoom models was that it has a view finder. It isn't like the old 35mm veiw finders. It was very difficult to see through. The camera is not perfect, but it took great pictures. Shaking is a real problem when using the zoom. That is to be expected. Most of my photos were clear inspite of the "shake" warning in the display. I dug out my old tripod and will be setting up the camera to take wildlife photos. No shaking that way! I used the video mode while on a rough ferry ride and at several beaches. Wish I had taken more video. Great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Exceptional!
Reviews.Author: T. Pilaczynski
Reviews.Content: This camera has everything I wanted and more, all for a great price. Transation through Amazon was perfect. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera, very satisfied, worth the money
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for several days, taken some shots with it. Overall really good quality, very easy to use, it's what I expect from Canon. And it's worth the money. Going to hopefully use it a lot when traveling or just taking random shots and videos.Love it.

Reviews.Title: Best PnS I've seen
Reviews.Author: mwaite
Reviews.Content: Just a few months into use, and I'll say I'm more than satisfied with the purchase of this camera. I've had and used quite a few point n shoots, and this is basically an entry level slr without the lens changeability.The miniature mode is quite amazing, and fun to play with. Makes everything in the center frame look like toys.The macro shots are absolutely awesome, and the possibilities are endless as to what you can shoot. Apply some imagination and get some great shots that are incredibly detailed for a camera in this price range.The zoom and focus points are truly incredible. We have a couple of PnS's that have pretty decent zoom and great focus, and this camera is untouchable in both those aspects. Add the image stabilization utilized with the furthest reaches of zoom, and the shots are great and very detailed.The nicest part is the ease of use and user menus. The battery life is astounding. The fact that it's not bulky or heavy makes it the perfect all-around camera in my eyes, light and fits into a small enough case that's it's comfortable and hassle-free to carry even while riding a bike or hiking.Auto and low light are not its strong points, but very livable and easy to work around. The manual features are great attributes of this camera. I'm not a big fan of auto settings and the fact that you can set your own aperture, shutter, ISO and focus make this a no-brainer if you're asking what to buy.As always, Amazon's service is the best, and among the best prices. You can expect it every time.I'm leaving things out I'm sure, will keep coming back to update.12/26/12 EditAfter more than a year and a half with this camera I'm still loving it, and still learning it. The low light capabilities could be better, but they're sufficient. Auto mode is unusable unless in bright light and outdoors. The flash works well for a factory piece. The timers and shutter speeds are great, aperature is decent, ISO is great at lower settings, and the many many shooting modes make it an amazing value. Still playing with certain settings and compositions learning all its abilities and shortcomings. Auto focus could be faster and has a lot of room for improvement. Although this may just be my camera, I've read many reviews mentioning the same about the lack of speed and accuracy in focus. Overall, still amazing for the price and I'm very happy with it! :O)

Reviews.Title: Aussie Man
Reviews.Author: Matthew Hall "MATILDA"
Reviews.Content: Canon SX30IS 14.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 Inch Wide LCDTHIS IS A FANTASTIC CAMERA.DOES EVERYTHING THAT IS STATED. VERY EASY TO USE. VERY STYLISH. MAKES ME LOOK PROFESSIONAL. I SUGGEST BUY A 32 GIG CLASS 10 SD CARD, THIS WILL GIVE YOU HOURS OF USE IN BOTH PHOTO AND VIDEO MODE. BY THE WAY THIS CAMERA IS A EXCELLENT VIDEO CAMERA. THE 32X OPTICAL ZOOM IS FANTASTIC IN BOTH PHOTO AND VIDEO MODE. EASY INTERFACE WITH PC AND TV. PLENTY OF PHOTO SIZE OPTIONS. BATTERY CHARGES REALLY FAST. LCD SCREEN IS BIG AND FLEXIBLE.BY THE WAY THIS CAMERA HAS A SUPRISE FEATURE, {WHILE VIDEOING YOU CAN TAKE PHOTOS AT THE SAME TIME WITHOUT MISSING A BEAT. THIS IS VRY USEFUL AT KIDS BIRHTDAY PARTY, CHRISTMAS OR ANY TIME YOU WISH YOU COULD TAKE A PHOTO OF WHAT YOUR VIDEOING.... FANTASTIC CAMERA..........................BY FAR THE BEST CAMERA I HAVE EVER OWNED AND I HAVE OWNED SIX IN PAST 40 YEARS.MATT

Reviews.Title: Extraordinary telescopic zoom with image stabilization
Reviews.Author: NaCl "NaCl"
Reviews.Content: The strength of this camera which is unmatched by any other camera at almost any price is the amazing 140x zoom. The higher MP count further helps digital zoom. Other reviewers advocating low MP count seemed to totally ignore this. The extraordinary zoom is the reason you buy the sx30is for. The IQ is very acceptable & you can make shots that otherwise just can't be accomplished with lower optical zoom combined with lower MP sensor digital zoom, e.g. a person's face or a number plate from >300 yards away. I use this camera also as a very powerful image stabilized telescope that I can aim freehand without a tripod. Totally happy with the wonderful optical technology for the price paid. To protect the lens, I purchased the 67mm adapter and a sigma multi-coated UV filter. This makes the supplied lens cap too small to fit the filter, which is actually a blessing because you have the camera always ready without having to take off the lens cap.

Reviews.Title: Little camera... big results
Reviews.Author: Jean Crreamer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for the great telephoto lens.  It is great to use when you don't want to carry a camera and all the different lenses on different shoots as it gets very heavy.  Of course, don't expect to take pictures as fast as you would with the Canon EOS cameras.  Great little camera for the price.  I have shown my camera to two other people who ordered one for themselves and they seem to be happy with it.

Reviews.Title: HDMI capabilty
Reviews.Author: L. Luft "Ludwix"
Reviews.Content: The SX30IS has capabilities way beyond my experience. The HDMI output permits direct connection to TV/display to  view the photo both prior and after exposure. The Display button can show the settings of the exposure. It permits easy comparison of settings vs. results and becomes a great teaching/learning tool. Love  it!In addition the available hot shoe permits on-camera mount of an  auxilliary flash. Others can be added as slaves.Lots  to learn.Canon SX30IS 14.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 Inch Wide LCD

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Shelley Coldiron
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic camera for pro-photographer wanna-bes who are camera challenged.  The design is easy to handle.  The features are easy to figure out.  It has the capability to be totally automatic or it has the flexibility and features to 'take control' and manually control the camera settings.  Fantastic zoom capabilities without having to switch out lenses.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who is an amateur like me.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for Money Product
Reviews.Author: A. T. Nema
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just recently and am amazed with its abilities considering its low price mark. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to step into the era of professional photography without having to spend a fortune. Canon well done for the price.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX30 IS
Reviews.Author: mr.lotus74
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic!Unless you are a camera snob, or only feel happy spending more than necessary, this Canon truly does everything well enough and the telephoto is incredible for bird photography. Everything works perfectly and I cannot think of anything to complain about. Even the digital zoom can be used if absolutely necessary, but over 35X (optical) you lose a lot and focusing becomes very difficult.The RCA connector allows you to play video or slideshow directly onto any TV with spectacular quality.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Natalia Agredo
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera and it takes wonderful pictures - I just wish it had a more accessible instruction manual.

Reviews.Title: cannon camera
Reviews.Author: pamela applebee
Reviews.Content: I love, love , love this camera. If you have a tripod every picture will be amazing. Even when it tells you to lift the flash, if you don't, the picture will come out exactly the way you see it, which is important when getting pics by candle glow.Canon SX30IS 14.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 Inch Wide LCDI have had this camera for almost 3 years now and still love it

Reviews.Title: It's a Canon Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: review4u
Reviews.Content: This little gem has been through hell and back with me.  It's very rugged, and seldom is safely stored in a camera bag.  I've taken her out too many of the cemeteries that I photograph and document.  The only thing I hate about this camera, is that all the function button are on the right side of the body.There is a thumb grip on the right side of the body as well, however, you'll find that your thumb is always falling off the tiny little thumb rest, and thus activating one or more of the special function buttons.  Very poor manufacturer design, placing all the buttons on the right hand side.

Reviews.Title: very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Mostafa E. M. Rateb
Reviews.Content: Canon SX30IS is a very nice camera, gives perfect photos and nice vedieo shots. in comparison with the SLR camera, it is much cheaper and quite professional.

Reviews.Title: super excelente
Reviews.Author: Leopoldo Suarez
Reviews.Content: La camara Canon SX30IS es superior a cualquier camara. Toma unas fotos excelentes. La recomiendo ampliamente. Es una camara que pueden utilizar tanto profesionales como personas novatas en fotografia.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Manuel Murillo Chaves "Manolo"
Reviews.Content: Excellent the camera you sent me.  I am too happy  with this camera,because  its pictures are very good and the video is excellent. Really, I made a very good purchising buying the camera XS30IS.  Thank you and my respects to you.

Reviews.Title: Fabulouss
Reviews.Author: gabs
Reviews.Content: I researched a lot about a good camera and I really found one. This camera is fantastic.. i still don't know how to use all the details that it provides but I'll soon have a photography course cause it's really worth considering the camera that I have now... I really recommend!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX30 IS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: D. Wilson
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality. I like the shutter focus and green box on view finder for picture " good to take ".Easy to use. Nice options for the more advanced photographer. Convienent pop-up flash. The Image Stabilizer is a must at this high of a Mega-pixel; 14.1 MP. It works well, too.

Reviews.Title: Great hybrid
Reviews.Author: Ronald
Reviews.Content: This camera is really a good hybrid, its very good value and looks just like a dslr. The form factor is lighter and more user friendly than most dslrs.

Reviews.Title: SX30is compared to SX1is RAW
Reviews.Author: cameramike "cameramike"
Reviews.Content: You can read all about the cameras on DpReview but I am only dealing with the final useful image quality.I have the SX1IS and SX30IS - the sensors are the big difference.  The SX1IS has a 10 megapixel CMOS and the SX30IS has 14.1 CCD. I have read that they are technically equivalent resolution.The SX1IS has RAW capability and the SX30IS does not. So I did my own comparison. Looks like they don't like links here - Go to cameramike dot com and select media tab. Find the images in full resolution. Just bought the SX30is. Not aware that Canon was going to release an SX40! Anyway - which camera should I sell?I like the miniature effect movie and 35X zoom on the SX30is.  Is the image quality going to be good enough? So my final deciding factor is end product image quality.  Looks like with de-noise applied to the SX30is it will be fine!A huge problem with the SX30IS - the viewfinder is so tiny - almost unusable.  I went to beach today with the SX1IS and the SX30IS - a very sunny day.  Tried to get some videos of some surfers, the SX30IS viewfinder so small the surfers were dots in the water.  the SX1IS viewfinder seems twice as large. No problem for same situation.  Anyone know if the SX40 is same as SX30 or SX1?Good thing I am in Costa Rica where selling used camera's is usually for a more than new retail in the US.I did try maxing the brightness of the display on the SX30IS but in the bright sunlight on the beach is not ideal - will try some more another day.[...]

Reviews.Title: Photography novice
Reviews.Author: hbmoe
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera. I chose this camera because of the simplicity of a point and shoot camera with an slr look and  Canon name. I thought this would be a good camera for me to experiment with and "if" I should get better would like to graduate to a more advanced camera. I'm having lots of fun with it!! It's pretty too.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX30 - Not an improvement
Reviews.Author: Railpast
Reviews.Content: I own a Canon S3 IS camera which took great photos and I loved it. It developed a "lens error" problem and would not start which is a common problem with these cameras. Canon wanted a $150 to repair so I decided to buy the SX30.I was very disappointed in it as it was hit and miss trying to get a good photo. Response and lag time it very poor and I missed many shots as it went through its power up scripts. The lens motor seems to be doing a lot of work every time you turn on the camera and it does not seem smooth. I am not sure how long it will last.The S3 was quick and had no trouble focusing on even moving objects but the SX30 had trouble even on objects that were not moving.I tried the camera in all modes and still had problems getting good photos. I have been using digital cameras for over 10 years and have a SLR so have an pretty good idea how to use them.I returned the camera and will look for something else.

Reviews.Title: Not worth for photos
Reviews.Author: shan
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews and personally test this camera, I returned it. Video and Zoom quality are excellent, no doubt.  But, not worth to pay this price because of its poor performance in image quality (I can say, you have to adjust too many settings to get a good pix, not my thing).

Reviews.Title: Zoom, zoom, zoom.
Reviews.Author: Ben Campbell
Reviews.Content: Trying not to set expectations too high for this machine was impossible, considering the exemplary product details and descriptions Canon set forth. For the $$$ I'd paid for this camera here at amazon.com, I'd write that I'm not disappointed with its performance yet my concerns must be expressed. I'm doing my best with producing excellent photos and videos with colors, depth, shadowing, angles, closeups and infinity shots, with my 20 years photographic experiences during my travels around the world. This is about the best Canon for amateur photographers. However, be aware of the HD video shooting. Below are 4 each of my main concerns with this Canon SX30IS. I have a few other concerns but they're less important. I gave this Canon 3 stars because my con issues should not have been issues with this slightly advanced HD digital.Cons:1. Low-light encourages graininess.2. Zooming on subjects produces slow focusing issues.3. Touchy fast zooming issues.3. Beware of the Zoom Framing Assist function while holding the camera during video. I made that mistake while shooting alive music performance at a Habitat for Humanity fund raising function. The lens started zooming in-and-out on theperformers until I'd figured out that my hand was accidentally depressing the Framing Assist button off-and-on.Pros:1. Excellent battery life.2. Lightweight body.3. Menu & function buttons easy access.4. Vari-angle LCD is exemplary and now mandatory for all my shooting. It's fantastic for getting overhead and underfootvideo shooting, as well as framing and composing special angles.I'm Ben Campbell, an author and videographer. I include photos I'd taken from around the world in my novels for visual reality purposes. Check out my novels here on amazon.com. They are available in Kindle download or paperback. DUBROVNIK

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: TJC "Tiffinie"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It seriously takes professional pictures and you would have never known they were point and shoot pictures! The only thing I do not like is the view finder, its just awkwardly placed.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Jade
Reviews.Content: Very HAPPY with the camera. I have to say all the Pictures I have took here in Germany have turned out great. I could have not found a better camera that makes my pictures look like a professional took them. Also very please with the zoom. I can zoom out a long way and they still turn out great with no blur. All in all I have to say this is a GREAT camera to own.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX30is
Reviews.Author: Jerry A.
Reviews.Content: The Camera is fantastic for handling, balance, weight, quality...The pictures are good enough for general photography most people would expect this type of camera to produce. Sharpness could be a little better, and noise in low light could be better. The optical zoom capability is beyond fantastic, and with no lenses to change! The HD video is just absolutley wonderful, as is the stabilization. The color brilliance is super! Overall I am more than satisfied with this camera, and would surely recommend it to an advanced amature. For the more than advanced amature...there is almost an infinite ability to go creative with your photography. There are just so many manually selected controls, that allow one to go where few have traveled.One last comment...Amazon did a fantastic job getting this camera to me in perfect shape. They indicated 5-7 days normal shipping time, I got mine in 3 days, and one day before Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX30 is The Best You Can Get
Reviews.Author: Maury Swoveland
Reviews.Content: I have owned almost all of the Canon SX series camera's, the SX 1, 2, 5, 10 and now the SX30 is. They have all been outstanding cameras. The SX30is gives incredibility clear images at all magnifications. I use the SX30is for wildlife photography so I do little shooting indoors. The outdoor quality is superb, the focus is very good and almost all the images are sharp, clear and colors are true. Low light accuracy is very good, with or without a flash. I would recommend this camera to a friend.

Reviews.Title: The Canon SX301S Absolutely Delivers
Reviews.Author: T. L. Starks
Reviews.Content: Over all, I love it.  It is light to carry and fairly easy to manipulate to get the best shots.  I am not overly happy with the slow zoom as I have to fuss with it quite a bit, although I do believe in time I'll get used to it's quirks.The video capability is one big plus I had not counted on.  Beautiful, easy to use and the quality of my videos is well beyond my expertise...the easy TV connect straight from the camera has made it effortless in presenting wonderful/wacky home made movies.This is the camera one should consider for indoor, outdoor don't-want-to-miss-that-fantastic-shot-of-the-full-moon-glow-on-the-snow-blue-land or the-Christmas-Eve-dinner-with-the-ketchup-faced-kids, all beautifully captured like fine memories...the Canon SX301S absolutely delivers.  My partner recently had his knee replaced and was getting a bit feverish in the cabin so I simply took the camera with me whenever I was outside- feeding the chickens, chasing the guinea fowl out of the greenhouse, shoveling two feet of snow- he got to see everything he was missing plus things he was thankful I got stuck doing, all by a quick connect and wa-la, the day's happenings came into complete and utter hilarity...in focus.I would not hesitate in recommending this fine gem of a camera.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: wanta know
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera ever.  There is nothingI can say bad about this camera. It just gives me fantastic pictures.  Being not a tech. person I had a little trouble with all the gadgets but the camera book is pretty easy to understand. A little effort and now the camera is like part of me.  I cannot say enough about how much I like this item.  I have looked at other cameras and none have been as inexspensive as my purchase on AMAZON and none can do what this camera can do.  They shipped this thing to me like in 4 days.  Everybody remarks that I am a camer pro. because I take some really great photos...it's the camera not me!

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: Natosha
Reviews.Content: I am in the process of boxing up this camera to return to Best Buy today (darn restocking fee!!).  I have had it a little over a week and have decided it is not for me.I am an amateur but I know what I like: a good, clear, and bright picture.  When I go on trips (Arizona especially) I like to have the ease of a good AUTO mode.  This Canon's AUTO mode stinks.  I normally use my aunt's old Kodak 8mp camera in AUTO to take gorgeous, clear, and true to color pictures when I trek to Arizona. I wanted to find my own camera instead of having to borrow one. The shots of corn fields, grass and landscape are dull both in AUTO and Landscape on the Canon.  The greenery is rather lackluster.  I would be seriously ticked if I had used this camera to take pictures of those amazing Red Rocks in Arizona! It was nice to be able to use the zoom to snap a photo of the full moon but that is not enough for me to keep it.  I have messed with the settings enough to know that over all, this camera could be so much better.I did like that I could manipulate my own settings in C1 and C2 and the reversing LCD monitor is cool.While I am not ready for a DSLR, I will now be deciding whether I want a Nikon Coolpix P500 or Sony DSC-HX100.  From what I have researched the Sony takes great AUTO pics and better pictures overall.  We'll see.

Reviews.Title: Very poor auto/P mode
Reviews.Author: Nag "Ghost rider"
Reviews.Content: I want to rate this camera with proper justification and analysis(see my pics). After 6 months analysis, I purchased canon sx30 camera and used it for 6 months. Surprisingly all ratings in Amazon(1 to 5) are absolutely correct. My rating for this camera is 3 stars.Why?Here it goes. Story started when I purchased camera in December. What a terrible initial days with this camera. As soon as I had received, I was very eager to click my sweety daughter actions. All photos are washed out, grainy, blurry. Yet, it produced very good photos when light condition was very good.As I was novice, then I faulted myself to learn camera tricks before blaming reputed manufacturer.Auto mode, auto auto!! Never got a single picture. Then I realized this camera is very poor in auto mode, it doesn't matter what condition you are in. It selects all wrong settings.Started learning all photography basics. Then moved to P mode. Again as this camera needs where good lighting condition, only some of the photos came good as long as I  selected correct ISO settings (Not less, not more it should be right ISO which is impossible to set when you click). I shot same photos with different ISO. What a pain!!!Again back to square, started learning advanced photography to use this camera. Moved to Av & Tv mode. Here I started getting excellent pictures (some are near to DSLR).This camera can't take Kids, pets actions in any mode other than Tv/Manual mode. One has to carefully play in Tv mode with ISO and flash to produce excellent Kids action photos.Manual mode. This is the mode where camera got ratings. Amazing photos! Like any other canon DSLR camera near to that. Colors and details are very good.Sports mode selects high ISO. So forget this mode.I bought this camera for high zoom assuming I would get same photo quality like any other Canon advanced camera. This was not upto my expectation. Story ended and I sold this camera with little loss.Bottomline: If you want to shoot (every scenario) in good lighting condition(mostly stills), Zoom is a must for your photography and want to spend some time like me in learning this camera I would recommend.If you are looking for quick clicks/Kids/action shots then I wouldn't recommend this camera.  Moreover stay away from Zoom camera category. Out of 1000 photos I clicked only 50 photos with more than 5x zoom. I am done with this and Now I am planning to go for S95/LX5/T3i.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: vivi
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera. I look like a professional photografer. The quality of photos is very high. It does everything automatically. And the zoom is fantastic.... But don't buy the offered acessories. They are not of good quality

Reviews.Title: Good Cam
Reviews.Author: lexluger
Reviews.Content: Nice bridge camera if you are not quite ready for SLR but want more than what the traditional point n shoot cam has to offer.

Reviews.Title: sx30is
Reviews.Author: peter w. cosgrove
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer, but this is an excellent camara. where I also don't no all about the features on this camara, I figure I will learn. but why I would recommend this camara, it's light, it takes great picture, but most of all the 35 optical zoom is fantastic. it's the reason I bought the camara. I own the sx20is also, it's a nice camara but when you zoom as far as it goes (80x), it's hard to keep the picture steady. but with the sx30is, zooming as far as it goes (140x), the picture is ALOT steadier and it's very easy to take a picture. but you should go to place that sells this camara, (best buy) and try it out yourself.  in my opinion it's worth buying if your looking for a camara with a strong zoom.

Reviews.Title: camera = picture quality <> SX30
Reviews.Author: N. sharma
Reviews.Content: I will not write a big review for this camera but just my experience with it. I waited for SX30 release for almost 4-5 months hoping canon would spin a marvel after sx20. I bought this camera as soon as it was launched. I tested it almost everyday for a over a month and loved the zoom and wide lens. Pictures turned out great most of the times except for moving things like car, squirrel or my kids and Indoor(oh boy poor!!). Images looked great on my 46" LCD and the day came when I had sufficient pictures and went to CVS to get prints, ooops!! all the pictures that I thought had come great and were looking fine on LCD have so much blurryness in them and that's when I decided better to sell it then to loose any money further on it. I sold it and I am happy about it. Intially when I saw some -ve reviews of camera, I ignored and told to myself that other's may not have tested properly and how can it be that bad(company like canon won't do that). But I think they are right atleast for the picture quality.Bottomline: Those who are looking to buy it, buy it for the zoom and wide lens!! Those who own it, I would recommend get prints asap and verify your photo's. I have kids and need fast camera and picture quality guess SX30 doesn't have both.

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied
Reviews.Author: Pranay "Pranay"
Reviews.Content: I am down-grading my initial rating of 5 stars to 1 star after spending additional time with this camera.  I was disappointed with overall quality of camera after taking some 400 odd pictures.  Very poor low light performance.  The only way I could get reasonable picture quality in day light is by using a tripod and decreasing shutter speed to over 1/10 seconds.  Returning the camera back to amazon.

Reviews.Title: canon pics
Reviews.Author: renshi77
Reviews.Content: I have found this product has very good zoom capabilities.  I took some great photos of the moon. Portraits are also fantastic.I recommend this camera to anyone

Reviews.Title: Canon SX30IS
Reviews.Content: What a great camera. I already have the (now relatively old) S5IS which I thought was great.  But the SX30IS is a BIG advancement over the S5.  I love them both the huge zoom on the SX30 and the more user-friendly controls makes it such a great advance over the older model.  The only negative I have is that in the S5 I could use plain-old AA batteries whereas the newer SX30 requires a Canon proprietary lithium-ion battery pack (which is much more expensive than multiple sets of AA batteries).  But I guess that the SX30 is much more power hungry than the older model and they had to do something to satisfy that hunger.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: TominSouthFLA
Reviews.Content: The Cannon SX30IS is a great point and shoot Camera.  I am very pleased with it.  I have had many point and shoot digital cameras. Most recently the Olympus SP-800UX with a 30X optical Zoom and the Nikon Coolpix P90. The Cannon SX30IS is better both of these cameras in every way except it is slightly heaver and larger.  The 35X optical zoom is great.  The quality of the images is superb. The SX30 will automatically switch to macro if I point at a close up object.  The image stabilization is outstanding.  I don't normally write reviews but I was so impressed with this camera I did.

Reviews.Title: Less than what I expected
Reviews.Author: buaques101
Reviews.Content: This is my first time writing a review ever. I feel like obligated to let the consumer know that the output quality of this product is less than okay. I own this sx30is for a month now and I have about a thousand pictures in it. I read all the review before I bought this canon and I can definitely attest that most of the bad reviews are correct. I am keeping this canon just because of its zoom capability. Less than good picture is always better than nothing.

Reviews.Title: arrived fast
Reviews.Author: S. S. "Super"
Reviews.Content: This was packaged like a new camera.  I did not find any problems or damage of any kind so far.  I have had it for a couple of months.  Seems great.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: part-time
Reviews.Content: this is very easy camera to work. it take great pictures and the zoom is out of this world. i love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: bmagill
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price!!!! I take it everywhere and love each and every shot.  My only complaint is that it did not come with instructions, I'm not sure if that is because I bought refurbished though.  I highly recommend this camera, especially considering I'm guessing at how to use it and all the pictures come out great:)

Reviews.Title: Pics are not that Great
Reviews.Author: Shark88
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera which I purchased from AAFES a couple of years now.  Originally bought it as an upgrade to a Nikon Coolpix P80 that I was using during frequent trips.  Not had any success with taking sunset pics.  The colors are just not there.  It's now collecting dust and I have switched back to the P80.  Will upgrade to the newer version of the P80 before my next trip and stick with Nikon in the future.

Reviews.Title: Most competitive
Reviews.Author: W. Wedum "Wendy K."
Reviews.Content: I have this camera and was shopping for a replacement at our office. This price beat the competition by $125. It's a last year's model and other businesses were charging more than what I paid for this new a year ago.  What's up with that?!Camera was shipped the same day I ordered and arrived 3 days earlier than promised.  Good Job!!

Reviews.Title: Indoor pictures not so good
Reviews.Author: J. Jones
Reviews.Content: I Purchased this camera from Amazon December 2, 2010 so I have quite a bit of experience with it. Outdoor pictures and generally video are fine with this camera. But after its failure to produce a decent indoor result again this Christmas I am compelled to warn you about the horribly poor indoor performance of this camera. In auto mode on normal indoor shots, (people moving about enjoying themselves) this camera will select a very high ISO resulting in sickening, grainy pictures. The only way to get a decent picture with it is to have your subject pose and use the flash, and that is not what I'm interested in. I want to take shots on the fly and have them turn out great on the auto setting. The CCD is not sensitive or fast enough to couple with the IS to produce acceptable indoor auto shots. I wish I had my wife taking pictures with my old Kodak DX6490 this Christmas because it takes way better indoor pictures than this camera can.

Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I go it as a graduation gift and haven't stopped using it since! It takes great pictures and videos. The battery life is also really good compared to other cameras!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: When I turn it on I never know when I will get a Lens Error and it shuts off. Very frustrating. Expected better quality from a Cannon. When it works the pics are great.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: I was sold on canon cameras by the brilliant pictures produced by their older camera's (ones with a superfine setting).  I switched from sony to canon this christmas (based on experience with SX10is and IXUS 90IS).  It was the biggest disappointment of the holidays.  (Anyone want to buy an SX30si and an IXUS 210?  Cheap.  Junk.)  If you like to shoot, zoom and crop.  Canon is the wrong camera unless you buy earlier models.  My wife has my old canon IXUS 90IS and she loves it.  I am stuck with her christmas presents - the newer models.  Canon - fire the engineers that convinced you that eliminating the superfine setting was a good idea.  I am looking around for the right camera maker.......again.  Don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: canon gives poor factory service. My camera was a lemon
Reviews.Author: Gloria Horwitz
Reviews.Content: I have had continuous problems with my camera. I have had professional photographers look at it and they can't get it to work correctly. I sent it in to the Canon Factory and they said nothing was wrong in their note in the return box after telling me they never received it. It came back unable to focus. Again I showed it to professional photographers and they said the camera was defective. I sent it back a second time. This time the factory tried to bill me over $100 on a camera that never worked and without reading all the paperwork their customer care center prepared for them. When I call Canon the people on the phone are responsive and nice but everything falls apart once it is sent into the factory. I even enclosed the memory card so they could see the pictures and see the problem. But they never looked. I think even their own service people are frustrated. But in the meantime I have a $400 camera that has never worked and Canon is not replacing it and seems incapable of fixing it. My daughter bought the same camera and hers works. My husband has the Rebel and his works. I think I got a lemon but if you get a bad camera from Canon you are in touble. I bought the camera through Amazon at Beach camera.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX30IS is okay. I have a canon powershot s2  and it is nearly 5 years old and it is as good as this camera.When I did the moon shot the SX30IS was slightly closerone says 35x opticalthe other 12x opticalthe difference is the Canon SX30IS has a wideangle and the SX30IS does not. As far as zoom distance goes there nearly the same

Reviews.Title: Awful viewfinder...much smaller than before..hard on eyes.
Reviews.Author: BoomerGal50 "BoomerGal50"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera yesterday and have already shipped it back. I own a Canon SX10is which is two models prior to this one. I've had that camera for 2 years and love it. The viewfinder on this camera is like peering thru a tunnel, very far away image and hard to see. It is much smaller than the image you see through the viewfinder on the Canon SX10is. I am 60 with the usual vision struggles of a boomer...I would definitely recommend looking thru the viewfinder on this model before you buy!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Cathy Ibach
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband for Christmas. He has the digital rebel and was looking for a camera that he could just grab and go. It is great! The zoom is terrific and it takes beautiful pictures. No more carrying 3 or 4 extra lenses to get the right shot!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Great Value
Reviews.Author: Fredc
Reviews.Content: All the features of the higher priced SLR cameras at an affordable price.  Easy Set-Up, Easy to Use, Powerful Zoom and Fantastic Pictures. Wished the camera came with a "Hard Copy" Users Mannual.  Mannual comes on a downloadable CD, which is not convient. All in all, I'm very pleased with the purchase. Would definetly recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: The best camera
Reviews.Author: Andres C.R.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because i wanted to advance from my casio exilim but i wasn't ready to get a dslr so i looked options of compact cameras that i could use manually and this canon was the best of all. Some reviews are not positive but in my case i use it in all modes auto, manually, program, etc and i get really good photos; saying that, some times in auto mode doesn't looks good so i take the photo again manual and totally changes to a great quality. The zoom is amazing, i had taken moon pictures very cool and also birds very far from where i am.It has a fish mode, miniature, flower, vivid colors... so many modes that you have to take your time to know the camera.The video is great, in my HD tv looks very real and i love it, you can use the zoom to get close while you are in video mode and that's great.This camera i think is semiprofesional so to use it you need to know basic stuff about digital photography so you don't expect to just point and shoot.I love my sx30is :D

Reviews.Title: Only So So
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a year and a half.  So far the only time this camera performes well is when there is wonderful light and a still subject.  I have taken some wonderful pictures with this camera some of which have ended up on the walls of my home.However I am an avid wildlife photographer which means I take a variery of Macro shots and lighting conditions.  I have taken hardly any pictures of wildlife that were worthy of keeping on my computer.  Even in Automatic Mode very very few pictues are worth keeping, most get deleted.  I have almost stopped trying to take pictures of insects all together.I went to the Atlanta Aquarium reciently (which was great!) and maby 5 out of 200 pictures come out worth printing out.  Most are blurry and not in focus.  And the pictues look great on the LCD screen but on the computer they are grimey and not in focus.Some pros are the zoom, when pictues come out good they are good, and the LCD screen is a good size.I would not recomend this camera to anyone.  Save the money and a small point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Worst. Camera. Ever
Reviews.Author: Burrill C. Leland
Reviews.Content: After using and loving the Canon Powershot A650-IS (now sadly discontinued), this camera has been a huge, grinding, depressing disappointment. I bought it for the vari-angle LCD, a vital feature for all kinds of photography imo, that Canon seems to be phasing out. They took what was a very easy-to-access mode for taking close-ups (press a button) and made it hard to get to (navigate a menu and select the right option. Then go backwards to get out), and the closeups it does take are crap. This camera is completely unable to focus on anything right in front of it. It cannot focus on blue. The zoom lens is ridiculously fussy to the touch, zooming and un-zooming seemingly at will which drives me insane. Ridiculously expensive!

Reviews.Title: DESCRIPCIÓN BREVE PERO PRECISA, EXCELENTE!!
Reviews.Author: Angel Finol
Reviews.Content: NO SOY FOTÓGRAFO PROFESIONAL, ASÍ QUE ME LIMITARÉ A SER MUY BÁSICO Y BREVE EN ÉSTA DESCRIPCIÓN DESDE MI PUNTO DE VISTA.Estoy completamente satisfecho con ésta Canon. No soy fotógrafo profesional, ni pretendo serlo, aunque me apasiona ese mundo. La cámara cumple todas mis espectativas.Las fotos con mucha iluminación son insuperables para mi, con poca iluminación y haciendo alto zoom se le dificulta para enfocar automáticamente, a pesar que la luz de ayuda al auntoenfoque se enciende.Cuerpo: La cámara se siente extremadamente sólida y fuerte, tiene una buena empuñadura que ayuda a sujetarla firmemente, y los principales botones, tales como; zoom, obturador, asistente de zoom, activación de flash, revisión (review), etc, se encuentran al alcance de la mano, sin necesitar grandes movimientos. Los botones, así como el circulo giratorio se sienten precisos al pulsarlos y tienen muy buen tacto. La pantalla multiángulo es de gran ayuda para no perder detalle al momento de fotografiar desde diversas perspectivas.Lente: Abarca un gran ángulo y no distorsiona en los bordes. Los colores son naturales y tiene un enfoque excelente en ambientes con buena iluminación. El macro es excelente, incluso a menos de 1cm.Video: HD 720p. El estabilizador de imagen funciona muy bien, incluso haciendo zoom a 35x mantiene la estabilidad de la imagen sin necesidad de usar trípode. Sonido estéreo, y muy buena calidad de sonido en general.Autonomía: Estuve 2 días probando fotografías y videos, configuración, en fin, aprendiendo todas sus funciones. la batería duró 2 días.Software: Intuitivo, fácil de usar, claro, preciso y moderno. Excelente. Incorpora muchos efectos para darle a la fotografía tales como, efecto miniatura, ojo de pescado, sephia, blanco y negro, detección de guiño, detección de sonrisa y saturación de colores, entre muchas otras. Los ajustes manuales son muy fáciles de usar, como el enfoque manual, abertura, etc.Visor o viewfinder: Aporta la misma información que en la pantalla LCD. Éste se enciende una vez que la pantalla se cierra o pulsando el botón "display". Es muy claro y tiene ajuste dióptrico.Correa: Tiene buena apariencia y buen tacto. La parte interna es de un material antirresbalante, lo que impide el desplazamiento lateral mientras se encuentra sujeta en el cuello del fotógrafo.Recomiendo la cámara 100%, si eres aficionado a la fotografía o simplemente un novato, ésta cámara cumple con todo lo necesario para obtener fotografías de gran calidad y excelente calidad de video sin vibraciones.Saludos desde Venezuela.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for Point-n-Shoot
Reviews.Author: David T. Jacobson
Reviews.Content: This was a great camera and I highly recommend it.  It took really nice pictures but I found that my friends were right and I needed a DSLR.  This one was the next step down.  Had some great manual features and was great as an automatic.My only complaint about it was there was no manual with it.  And the manual explains all the manual and overrides while the quick start guide that was includes just goes over the basic features and automatic ones.

Reviews.Title: More Options but Less Reliable
Reviews.Author: UBSL
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 2 months ago thinking I was buying a good "quality" camera from one of my favorite brands: Canon.In summary... I kept on getting a lot of bad pictures in low light situation ... 35X zoom sounded really good but only made the images' quality worst.... They should recall this model and gives everybody their money backAll the bad comments on this camera are accurate..... I returned the SX30IS at the end and hope that next year they'll come up with a better model

Reviews.Title: Makes snooty DSLR people mad
Reviews.Author: AC
Reviews.Content: Does all it claims to do very well.  From point and shoot to a wide variety of manual settings, this is an easy to learn, and fun to use camera that takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: SS
Reviews.Content: Good product. great 24 - 840 mm lens. Can shoot wide angle to super zoom stills with ease.  The video quality is good but the file size is pretty bulky.  Good battery life.

Reviews.Title: So sad
Reviews.Author: Mark Nissen
Reviews.Content: First of all, I like canons and usually buy them over all others, so when I was planning on upgrading from my sx110, I was happy to see this camera.  Then I started taking pictures, I felt the image quality was very poor, and I had taken several 100 pictures.Video wasnt that bad.  Where the buttons were was terrible, kept hitting the zoom button.....ugggg.  So I have taken it back and bought a Dslr.  I hope this isn't the future of canon nicer point and shoots..  I still like my sx110, it shot much higher quality pix than this camera did. The sx30is was a huge dissapointment

Reviews.Title: Burry and not good under low lighting...
Reviews.Author: L8aR
Reviews.Content: When using the zoom the picture comes out blurry.  Two people can be on the same picture and one will come out blurry and the other one fine.... It could be that I got a damaged camera but I am returning it... very dissapointed...

Reviews.Title: Disappointing! Not worth the money!
Reviews.Author: R. A. Vries
Reviews.Content: Canon will have their reasons for producing camera's of a lesser quality than their older camera's, I suppose. But I don't get it! If I were the manufacturer of camera's I would want to have pleased and satisfied customers and not have so many of my camera's shipped back to the seller. Like so many of us, I basically want an easy to work with camera, that delivers beautiful pictures, without having to drag a heavy DSLR body and multiple lenses around and without having to deal with technical issues when making photo's. So a point and shoot camera is the best option for someone like me! Without going into detailed technical issues I'll share my experiences on the SX30IS with you. Before I purchased the SX30IS from Amazon, I have been working with the Canon Powershot G5 for about 6 years. I have always been very satisfied with the quality of the pictures that the G5 provides! The main reasons why I wanted another camera was that the Canon Powershot G5 is a pretty slow operating camera, I wanted more zoom range and I wanted higher resolution photo's. The SX30IS seems to provide all this. After having used the SX30IS for about 1 hour, it was clear to me that this camera is a huge downgrade in comparison to the older Powershot G5. The Powershot SX30IS still is a very slow camera. It has a very slow powerburst (calling this powerburst a powerburst is just ridiculous). The powerburst of the older Canon Powershot G5 is a lot faster than the SX30IS and the quality of the SX30IS pictures is not up to par. Pictures are by far not as sharp as the G5 pictures and also the colors are not as vibrant! When comparing the pictures of the newer Powershot SX30IS to the pictures of the older Powershot G5, the older G5 pictures are a true pleasure to view and the G5 stands out by far! Of course I don't know.., but as far as I am able to tell, this is due to the fact that Canon dismissed the Super Fine setting from the newer models. The older Powershot G5 has 3 settings: Normal, Fine and Super Fine. The newer SX30IS only has 2 settings: Normal and Fine. The difference in picture quality is obvious! A photo camera is for taking beautiful photo's. That's all there is to it!!  No matter how many fancy technical features they stick on a camera to impress the customer, the bottom line is and will always be the quality of the pictures we make with them. And the pictures of the Canon Powershot SX30IS do not cut it! I've shipped the camera back to Amazon and as usual Amazon was very good about refunding the money. No problems there.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy
Reviews.Author: hls
Reviews.Content: To start with I have been using Panasonic cameras and not used to the acronyms and buzz words Canon uses.  I bought the camera because of the 35X lens to take bird pictures.  I know that that is asking a lot of any point and shoot but I have done pretty well with my Panasonic 18X point an shoot.But this camera has too many features, most of which I don't understand.  A guide does not come with the camera!  I would happily pay another ten bucks for a good manual.  I did downloaded a pdf file guide from somewhere and was able to get it into my Kindle which at least made it portable.But the guide is horrible.  It's hard to find anything and then I don't understand what I'm reading.The auto focus and light settings are too slow to catch fast moving little birds.  I have some good pictures but the bird has to sit still for a couple of seconds.  And I still haven't been able to figure out how to use the manual shutter feature.  I may not have it set up right but I have tried to sort it out.  I'm sure that it is a good camera for typical point and shoot use.  But I wish I hadn't bought it.If anybody knows how I can make a useful bird camera out of this thing I would love to hear from you.

Reviews.Title: Cat Friendly
Reviews.Author: Vidiot
Reviews.Content: This camera has a very good zoom lens however the compromise seems to be (particularly in the 'auto' mode) image sharpness. When photographing distant objects, objects in the foreground tend to be out of focus but with  customized settings careful framing and some post-production this can be overcome.All things considered a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great x35 Zoom
Reviews.Author: Smiley
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Great zoom function. You don't need a large telephoto lenses. One thing I do not like is that I would unintensionally press one of those buttons when shooting.

Reviews.Title: GREAT GIFT
Reviews.Author: David Arvelo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a christmas gift for my wife , she loved it ! enought said , thank you Amazon for making my wife very happy this hoilday season.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Prasanth Pendyala "Pendy"
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera to possess. I simply love this Cam, would recommend this camera to all those who hate to carry big SLR's. This powerful camera has a inbuilt wide angle lens. I am loving it even after 8 months of the purchase :)

Reviews.Title: Can you use the SX30 for Bird Photography?
Reviews.Author: Carl T. Ball "Carl"
Reviews.Content: I returned the Canon SX30 after trying to use it for 7 days.  I mostly wanted it to take bird and nature pictures.
