I currently have a Canon 50D and 70-200mm f/4L lens and a Canon G9, with which I have taken over 50,000 pictures in the last 2 years.I found getting the SX30's zoom lens to extend to where I wanted it to be vexing - the lens acted like it had a mind of its own and didn't respond to my commands.  The viewfinder had an unsatisfactory resolution that made finding a small bird in a tree extremely difficult or impossible.  95% of my pictures were not in focus, but I did get a few very good pictures - not very reliable if you can only have a chance to get one picture of a bird.  I decided using it was too much hassle and frustration, but now I definitely want a super zoom lens - so I am ordering a Canon 400mm f/5.6L and some extenders.

Reviews.Title: Does everything
Reviews.Author: B3
Reviews.Content: I haven't tried every setting possible with this camera - that will take some time.  However, I have gotten really nice pictures using some of the more basic settings, and I have gotten some really nice pictures using the manual settings for apature and exposure.  This is not your basic point and shoot camera, although I've gotten more than acceeptable pictures using it as such. My less expensive Canon SD 850 IS is a better camera for pure point-and-shoot than the SX30 IS.  This should not be construed as a put-down of the SX30.  This camera will do so much more than the 850 - and that is reflected in the price differential. The SX30 IS is a great camera.  Although slightly heavier than some of the competition, weight is not an issue.  This is still a light camera, but it feels like you are holding something.  The 35x zoom is incredible. This was my primary reason for purchasing the camera and I have not been disappointed.  Image stabilization was also a requirement for me, and again, I have not been disappointed. Plenty of review cover a lot of the other bells and whistles on the camera - all worth having.  However, you can set the camera to take a picture when someone winks, or when someone smiles, or when someone enters the cameras view; and. the camera won't take a picture if someone's eyes are closed. These are all controlled by settings in the camera's program.  They are really nice to have when shooting pictures of the entire family.  A word of caution here for prospective buyers: You have to read the manual (on the enclosed CD) to learn about these and other "tricks" the camera can do.  If you aren't into reading manuals then you might think this is just another camera that will work as a point-and-shoot but has a lot of other buttons and dials. Take the time to read the manual and you'll enter a whole different world of photography. If you do this you won't be disappointed in what the camera can do.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Full Zoom Images
Reviews.Author: Matthew D. Ruffell
Reviews.Content: I should have known the 35x zoom was too good to be true. I used it at an outdoor football game the day after I bought it.  Was hoping to capture the players from the stands. The zoom and focus seem to work well and I took about 100 shots, all different angles, different ISO modes, and various shutter speed settings. When reviewing the pics on the camera display I thought to my self, WOW these look great even at full zoom. Then I got home and downloaded the pictures on my PC.  What a difference when looking at the pics in full res.  They are very poor. Over exposed and grainy. I kept around 20 out of 100 pics. Very disappointed. This is the second Canon camera I have taken back in 3 years because I was suckered by the Canon fanatics and false reviews. Image quality is king, not the name brand of the camera. I am going to get a micro four thirds camera next (probably a Panasonic). I heard the micro four thirds cameras are like next gen DSLRs with large sensors, yet small and high quality.  I am done with point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: Sin tener experiencia en cámaras, esta me ha sorprendido, tiene un tremendo zoom, es liviana con respecto a sus similares, viene con sus programas y todo lo necesario para ser un fotógrafo semi-profesional de muy fácil manera. Yo sin haber tenido nunca una cámara, recomiendo 100% este producto.

Reviews.Title: MY CANON
Reviews.Author: RAFY
Reviews.Content: THIS MY FORTH DIGITA CAMERA AND THE BEST FROM FAR. I THINK THAT THERE COULD BE SOME INPROVEMENT IN THE NIGHT SHOTS. OTHER THEN THAT IT IS A GRAET CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Chad J. Hicks "Sheri Hicks"
Reviews.Content: Ok even though I have only had this camera for a few hours, I LOVE it. It is easy to use, the picture quality is great and it was the perfect price for me. I think the only thing I would change on it like others, is an automatic pop up flash instead of having to do it yourself, but that is just minor and no big deal. I researched for weeks before I decided to go with this one as an anniversary gift. If I was gonna spend this much money I wanted to make sure there was not gonna be any regrets down the road and there are so so many positive reviews for this camera that it only made sense that I went with it. It was highly rated and knew I couldn't go wrong it.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera, its not too big neither too small, fits well on your hand, nice photos, however you need to get used with it, specialy the night shots. Some night shots gets realy good, but some gets fuzzy when is set to auto. Day's photos are nice, with vibrant colors, no cromatic aberration so far. The camera came with a stuck pixel on CCD sensor that I'm still trying to figure how to get rid of it. The zoom is amazing, I took a photo from the full moon with 35x + some digital zoom and looked perfect. The image is not sharp as a dSLR, but is only noticeble by very sharp eyes. Beside the stuck pixel it is a beautiful camera, still expensive though.

Reviews.Title: Picrs from the Eclipse with this camera
Reviews.Author: Mommyof2CntryBoys
Reviews.Content: My friend has this camera and took pics of the Eclipse December 21,2010 and they turned out perfect and so clear and so close . This is a great camera and takes really great pics .[...]A link to the picture she took.

Reviews.Title: Liking this camera
Reviews.Author: christine
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, BUT i wish i would of spent a bit more on a better camera. like a dslr!

Reviews.Title: nice distance pics
Reviews.Author: Cindy S. Tannen
Reviews.Content: read the manual that you can download online.  and practice shooting.  a little big and bulky for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: My
Reviews.Author: GolddustWoman
Reviews.Content: money was well spent on this camera, I use it every day.  I like that it is a point and shoot, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Works great but...
Reviews.Author: dw
Reviews.Content: Saw my brother-in-law's canon SX20 with the extended zoom capabilities so I sold my Nikon camera and bought a Canon SX30.  The camera and zoom I really like but miss my Nikon with its rapid fire shutter action.

Reviews.Title: no book of instructions
Reviews.Author: Blondie
Reviews.Content: I just bought the Canon SX30IS and as it comes with no book on how to use it, can someone tell me how to get Macro shots?????  I love flowers and have always done a lot of that type of shooting and now can't figure this one out!!!  help

Reviews.Title: Very poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Satheerthan S. Nair
Reviews.Content: This camera has very poor picture quality in Auto mode. In PE mode pictures look better but not acceptable for a $400 camera. Beware!!! This is not at all a point and shoot camera. For me this is a 400$ paper weight. I am wondering what happened to canon to make such a camera?. May be I got a faulty camera?. If it is a faulty one what happened to canon's quality control. I returned this camera. Highly disappointed...Canon deleted my review from their website. I hope Canon can't delete this.Thanks to Amazon for their excellent customer support.

Reviews.Title: Thought I found the perfect camera!  NOPE!!!  :(
Reviews.Author: Jmom 2
Reviews.Content: Thought I found the perfect camera.  After many hours of research trying to find a DSLR "LIKE" Camera, I thought this was perfect.  Until I started to use it!  Not user friendly, hard to find things on the menu.  Started out by taking things in the "auto" mode.  Well lets just say that my old camera (an HP Photosmart 7 mp) was taking more clear pictures in compairson. Auto mode should be just that "auto".  Even in Manual mode I found it very complicated to use and just not getting a clear picture.  VERY GRAINY and fuzzy.  Zoom is great but takes a long time to focus and you might miss your shot for a great photo.  I got a total of about 10 good photos out of 100.  Would have been very upset if I had been on vacation and ended up with fuzzy pictures.  I am very dissapointed and sad to say it's going back to the store.  Guess I'll stick with my pocket HP since it takes CLEAR pictures...

Reviews.Title: A good super-zoom
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use.  The zoom is "sick" but you will have a lot of noise because of the high ISO.  Low light performance on par with cheap point and shoots.  One shot per second is very disappointing for a camera in this price range.  All in all a great little camera for the kids.

Reviews.Title: Excelente Camara
Reviews.Author: Erick Salazar CH
Reviews.Content: hola a todos, me compré esta cámara y siento que para ser amateur en la fotografía es la mejor compra que he realizado, me gustó mucho la cantidad de zoom que tiene, es simplemente exagerado (demasiado bueno) y tiene muchas funciones, en las cuales les recomeiendo leer el manual, ya que de lo contrario a menos que sepas de camaras no le vas a desifrar todo lo que se puede hacer con ella.si te gusta tomar fotos en ráfaga no es tan rápida como otras profesionales, sin embargo es una muy buena opción.mi recomendación es Comprala, es excelente

Reviews.Title: Canon sx30is
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: So far so good!  Haven't really used the camera a lot yet, except for some video I shot.  The proof will be in the putting!  Taking it to Paris next month!

Reviews.Title: Night landscapes, cityscapes underwhelming
Reviews.Author: Jim "Killer Boots"
Reviews.Content: I want to make this review pretty brief because I have only had the camera a couple of weeks and have only just begun to test and experiment with it.All I want to comment on is the ability of this camera to take night cityscapes. I live in Hong Kong, so there's always great opportunities to take cityscapes.The problem is that after experimenting with all manner of aperture values, shutter speed and ISO...I am getting 9 out of ten photos that are very smeared and poor. I have disabled Image Stabilization. I use a tripod. I set a 10 second timer to take shots. I keep the ISO at 80 to prevent graininess. I use manual focus. Basically all I want to do is take a shot from my veranda which shows a bank of about 15 buildings about 400/ 500 meters away stretched out across the horizon. In the background are dark mountains. In the foreground is a leafy park lit pleasantly in places by lights.I can't figure out how to get a decent shot. My old camera is a Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1...a simple point and shoot. It outperforms the Canon in these night time shots. With the Lumix, I set it up, set 'Starry Sky', select a 15second shutter speed, use the timer...it takes the photo and buildings are crisp, the sky is deep, the foreground is focused...everything is focused. The colours are rich.I've tried everything it seems (although I hope there is something simple I'm missing...) with the Canon...but the shots are smeared, slightly out of focus, bland and just awful.It's been suggested to me on the internet that in order to focus properly I should set wide angle to infinity focus then 'back off' a little from there. Also it's been suggested to choose a target in the shot and focus on it. But it's hard to select a specific target in a 2.7" viewfinder that is 500 meters away...at night! It all looks kind of grainy in the live viewfinder. So how am I supposed to focus flawlessly on some feature 500 meters away? I thought that if I just set the widest angle that my DOF would be the biggest and pretty much everything would be focused.If anyone happens to read this review and has mastered night time cityscape shooting...please give me some feedback.One last thing....shots at night that are closer (for example, I took some shots of subjects/ structures much much closer than the 500 meters...like in a bus depot under lights at night etc) these shots came out way, way better. Could it be that the horrible pollution of HK is effecting my long range shots? Lately there has been a funk in the air you could cut through with a knife!But if that was the case........why does my little Lumix still take acceptable (and perfectly focused) shots in these conditions and the Canon does not?I am suspicious of the Canon's night abilities.Any thoughts anyone...anyone?EDIT: After reading a lot of advice on the net I have started to take a different approach. I am still in Manual mode for these night cityscape shots...but have decided to use auto focus more rather than the manual focus...pressing half way until the green box gives me the all clear. I was told that manual focus is virtually impossible to ascertain in a night fed grainy magnified LCD viewfinder...and I have to agree...especially when the subject is buildings 400 meters away. I also was always willing to accept user error here and at this stage I think I may have solved my problems...and that yeah, they are user error. Earlier I don't think I ever 'half-clicked' to secure the green focus box. When in auto focus mode earlier I think I just pointed and shot.  The smog is outrageous here at the moment so I'm not getting brilliant shots...but latest tests have given me much more satisfying focus. And that was my first hurdle. I'll continue to test the camera....I hope this disgusting smog clears up soon.

Reviews.Title: Does Not Deliver
Reviews.Author: rfr "rfr"
Reviews.Content: After six months with this camera, I am disappointed to the max.  Just does not deliver good pictures, always seem a bit fuzzy.  Have tried everything.  Sadly, I am outside the warranty and don't even know how to specifically complain to Canon.  All the pictures just seem flat and lifeless barring a few close-ups.  Spent too much.  The camera I have does not seem to match the camera the satisfied reviewers own.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Tony C
Reviews.Content: Looking for a camera for my wife and came around this gem. The optical zoom is freaking amazing, the buttons are all very well placed and the large screen make this an awesome buy. My wife had a sony something or other that consumed rechargable AA's like waterin the desert. The battery on this baby last forever. The only thing that isn't clear in all the reviews I searched for everywhere on the internet is that the lens is not interchangable. That part sucks but the rest of the camera is great. Make sure you get the extra battery when purchasing. You don't want to get caught with a dead battery because you have your head in your butt while on vacation and forgot to charge it.

Reviews.Title: Una cámara sorprendente
Reviews.Author: Jorge Barrantes
Reviews.Content: Hace pocos días compre mi camara Cannon, anteriormente tuve una Panasonic fz5. La experiencia con la Cannon Sx30is es totalmente diferente. La calidad de las fotografías es sorprendente. El alcance de zoom también es sorprendente sin embargo es preferible usar un trípode para estabilizar más la imagen. El software es muy bien pensado para dar una experiencia realmente profesional.

Reviews.Title: it is a beatifull camera
Reviews.Author: alexis
Reviews.Content: Esta canmara era lo que estaba buscando , facil de usar , calidad en las imagenes asi como en los videos rapidez al tomar fotos , y un muy buen zoom Se la recomiendo a todo aquel que no sea un profesional en este tema de las fotografias , pues con esta camara no hay que tener mucho conocimiento por lo facil de manipular y la calidad de las fotos .

Reviews.Title: real nice
Reviews.Author: H. Bowman "Mailman"
Reviews.Content: Took alot of shots at 36 zoom....Real nice.....camera is great...also have fz100...sx20is....this is better....Bought 2 batt plus charger for 17.00....USA shipper Ebay....California....Works ok will test on Labor weekend (Batt)..My biggest complaint is on-off button....Very easy to turn on...Bought lowepro 110 13.00 tight fit but ok....I will just remove batt when I transport....

Reviews.Title: Extremely happy with my new Canon SX30IS
Reviews.Author: marolyn "addicted to reading/listening to Mur...
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX30IS is a must buy if you want the best zoom, amazing photos, a lot of very useful features, such as, Automatically dating your pictures when you take the picture (which is the most important feature to me). Each time I use my Canon SX30IS the more I love it. I love being able to shoot videos and am able to take pictures while I am shooting videos. That is an awesome feature which I love. This camera is well worth the money. This camera take the best photos and video, which is very important for those very special occasions. If you are looking for a digital camera that has so many very good features and takes the most amazing photos and videos this is the camera for you. I hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: my wife loves it
Reviews.Author: Tony Ciccariello "ajciccar"
Reviews.Content: got this for my wife for christmas and she loves it, the pics almost look 3 dimensional they are so clear and crisp.  i bought it from amazon, buy it, you'll love it

Reviews.Title: Lemon, not of mechantable quality or quality control gone bad
Reviews.Author: No_Pen_Name
Reviews.Content: Be very careful you don't accept this item:PowerShot SX30ISID/Serial number on the camera: 102052000707SHORT VERSION: The still images were no better than with my $99.00 'Nikon coolpix L22'; disappointed to say the least.  Not sure if this item is a lemon, not of merchantable quality (across the board) or, quality control gone wrong.This camera, for over $300.00, just couldn't or wouldn't focus correctly for our close-ups no matter auto/manual tripod or not.  The camera would activate the flash when no flash was needed.PowerShot SX30ISID/Serial: 102052000707The ratings I offered were based on my personal experience with the product.  Currently waiting for a 'Panasonic Lumix DMC-G2 12.1 MP' to replace this Canon.  That will be my next review/experience.  If it doesn't beat out the Nikon named above; I'm done with mirror-less rigs.Take care folks, watch out you don't get the device with the above serial number.

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: NACHO GATTI
Reviews.Content: Este ítem es excelente. Lo compre desde Argentina para que me lo envíen a mi hotel en Orlando y llego muy bien. Muy buena cámara para tener fotos de las vacaciones o de eventos.

Reviews.Title: Just a little better than a run of the mill point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Markymark
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for quality pictures at close range or at super zoom, save your money.  If you are used to point and shoot quality this is ok but, if you want entry level DSLR photos you will be disappointed with the photos from this camera.  The zoom is great if you want to shoot wildlife or spy on someone but the photo's are just average.  If you want quality shots look at the olympus pl-1 or other 4/3 cameras or wait for the new Fuji hs20.  The Fuji might be a winner.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Felipe
Reviews.Content: if you are tired of your small camera but dont want to spend with a professional this is the one. i recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good so far
Reviews.Author: D. Cholakov
Reviews.Content: Works well so far.Issue on "value for money": price fell after I bought the product; that's always disappointing

Reviews.Title: Horrible HD video, mediocre photos!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Pratt
Reviews.Content: The camera is very simple to use.  The manual modes are very intuitive.  Really nice zoom lens with image stability.  That being said, the HD video recordings are horrible!  They are .mov format so you need to use Apple Quicktime - good if you use and Apple computer, really bad if you have a pc.  Quicktime is very slow on a pc.  Movement is very choppy in the videos (although image quality is sharp) - I don't have a slow computer.  Latest version of VLC plays quicktime format but not from videos made from this camera!?  Converting file to ISO and playing on a DVD player, the video is very degraded.  Playing hd video from the camera to a television with supplied cord has poor image quality and the colors are off.  Using the television as a monitor and using the supplied chord attached to the camera, colors are completely wrong and video quality is degraded.  Still picture images are soft.  I purchased this item through Amazon and I'm in the process of returning it.

Reviews.Title: its greattttttt............
Reviews.Author: K. Chaudhari
Reviews.Content: I bought this one for my brother....and its just amazing...35X zoom..wow...I got really nice snaps quality...it tempted me to keep it for myself...

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is awful
Reviews.Author: NatalieC
Reviews.Content: I have a Rebel t1i, i was going to buy a telephoto lens..but decided to try this camera. The picture quality when used in the zoom feature is poor at best. The auto focus constantly moves, it never settles on the object. Image stabilization is also bad. In the special features, such as vivid , the picture quality is also grainy and poor. I would skip purchasing this camera. I feel I got ripped off for almost 400 dollars.

Reviews.Title: Not sure
Reviews.Author: Gabrixre
Reviews.Content: No estoy del todo segura que esta sea una buena camara, la compre hace 2 meses y he tratado de investigarla lo más posible.  Uno de los inconvenientes que veo, es que las fotos tomadas con flash no son de buena calidad, y en la noche ni digamos, aún cambiando los ajustes de sensibilidad (ISO) las fotos no me convencen.

Reviews.Title: The Best Canon Point & Shoot on the market today
Reviews.Author: CariM
Reviews.Content: I've owned many Canon cameras from my first film ones when I was younger to the SLR AE before going digital. The first of those was a huge mistake, on the advice of a friend I got a Point & Shoot Olympus which I managed to give to my brother in law and then went back to my favorite manufacturer. That was an SD400 and it served really well even though it's optical zoom really didn't zoom much and video was mono but it was great at concerts because it was so small, no security guard ever found it in my purse! Then, wanting better I moved on to the S5IS which took great photos & stereo video. This was in the days just before HD so it did produce 4:3 output but it was certainly good at it and the photos (with it's 12x optical zoom) were superb. For those times when only a DSLR will do I have the Rebel XSI and a couple of extra lenses and a SpeedLite flash unit (EX 300). Of course I got the last but one DSLR that doesn't do video but that's always the case. This year we ventured further and got the SD3500 for the small camera essential times and just before Black Friday I picked up the SX30IS at a real bargain. The real bugbear of the S5 as far as I was concerned was those 4 x AA batteries; even if you use rechargeables you always have to carry spares and carrying st least 8 in my purse created weight I didn't need. ALL the other Canons used small squarish gray units and a very compact recharged so my purse is now happy again. All the photos so far have been great & the HD video is even better. As with the S5, the strap could be thicker, like the one the Rebel uses, I find the thin one cuts into my neck. And FINALLY Canon seem to have solved the dreadful issue of the lens cap falling off usually as inappropriate moments! 35x optical zoom is awesome & I cannot wait to take it to concerts. Most venues now say cameras are OK but not professional. I've always gone by the rule that professional cameras are ones that have intercheable lenses (like the Rebel & Canon's wonderful but unaffordable for me) EOS range, so that gets it past security. I think most venues have decided that confiscating phones with cameras could be detrimental to their security guards' health (having several hundred iPhones/Smartphones to return to the right owners wouldn't be an easy task) so they are a little more forgiving to the venue patrons) so I can't wait for my next concert or day trip.

Reviews.Title: This Cannon delivers a LOT for the money!
Reviews.Author: Barb
Reviews.Content: I got this camera instead of the Panasonic Lumix only because of the higher zoom capabilitity.  I've taken stunning photos of wildlife.  I've used the articulating screen option many times for difficult shots.  Haven't used the low lite feature, yet, for night shots.  I wish there were more easy-to-use menu functions like the Lumix, but I think I can get the functions I need as I learn more about the AV/TV.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: cptronier
Reviews.Content: go o oo oo ooo oo oo oo oo oo oo oo oo oo oo oo oo oo oo ooooooooooooooooooood. i loved it

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: DrewSpencley
Reviews.Content: For a point and shoot, this camera is decent. The prints are alright if shot correctly, but it is lacking sharpness. Indoor pictures turn out a little noisy and it is sometimes hard to capture things correctly. Things get over exposed alot and things don't look the same on the computer as they do on the LCD. I'd say if your doing photography for fun then get this camera. If your looking to be professional then go with a standard SLR if not higher.

Reviews.Title: Probably a Lemon!
Reviews.Author: Henrik E. Hansen
Reviews.Content: I love Canon cameras!  I shoot with a 5D MK2 and all "L" glass.  For my wife's birthday, I bought this for it's versatility, light weight and ease of use. The results were awful!  Grainy, very poor sharpness and color balance that was nowhere near the mark. I returned it for service and Canon replaced the guts.  It's now marginally better, but my I Phone 4 takes better pictures.  It's going back again for a second try.  Based on the reviews, I can only conclude that this is a lemon.  I just hope they get it right this time. In my frustration, I recent bought her a Rebel T3, which I reviewed.  Great entry level camera.

Reviews.Title: Would not buy again
Reviews.Author: LuluBelle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take crisp clear photos of my daughter's wedding.  Since I am not a professional photographer and the wedding took place in so many settings, from bright sun to under the tent at night with the flashing lights and Japanese lanterns, I relied on my new camera's auto settings to adjust for me.  What a mistake!  The auto setting for this camera apparently uses a very high ISO setting and the photos are almost all blurry.  The only photos that look good are the ones I took while my Canon camera battery charged.  Then I had to use my old Kodak which is a 5 megapixel. The ISO setting for auto on that camera is half that of the Canon. I sent the Canon in for repairs but they said to lower the ISO settings because that caused the blurriness.  So why is it set that way?  I wish I had bought the Nikon for the same price.The zoom settings are good but it is not enough to make up for not trusting this camera to take a good shot when I need it.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX30IS is awesome
Reviews.Author: Vijetha
Reviews.Content: I Love it, its really awesome product. Worth for my money.Thanks to canon for such a wonderful Zoom (35X). Great experience while capturing objects beyond my eye limit.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price.
Reviews.Author: Thomas G. Curro
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. It is loaded with features that the average photographer will find adequate in this quality of camera.

Reviews.Title: canon sx30 what a ripoff of money canon should be ashamed
Reviews.Author: J. Kahrs
Reviews.Content: i bought the canon sx30 on friday and returned it on monday what a piece of garbage for $400. the 35x optical zoom operates sometimes by itself without any button touches and sometimes when u try to zoom with the buttons it doesnt work at all. the picture quality is terrible in auto mode and not much better in the program mode. i read some reviews on other sites and i see other customers have had the same problems so i called canon only to be told by canon nobody has complained about any problems with the sx30.  i find that very hard to believe.  the sx20 was a great camera but the sx30 is a piece of garbage. stay away from it if u can.

Reviews.Title: Canon rules!
Reviews.Author: Lokesh
Reviews.Content: most amazing feature of this camera is easy to focus on the area you want to emphasize in a picture in all different scenarios. Only thing I found that can be considered as negative, is its bulkiness! but you can't have those much features in a small and light camera.

Reviews.Title: Just an average camera
Reviews.Author: ri
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews of this product prior to its release and could not wait to get my hands on it, NOW I CAN'T WAIT TO GET RID OF IT. This is not the Canon cameras of old. This camera produces very poor image quality in the AUTO mode and isn't the auto mode what you buy a point and shoot for!!! I received one of the first cameras upon release and I guess its like a new car with a model change. Wait until they get the bugs out. I had a Canon S5IS that was a much better product than the SX30IS.What I shame Canon has a new camera with tons of features that falls way short of its mark

Reviews.Title: Still taking it for a test drive ... (U~U)
Reviews.Author: The Fallen Angel with a broken Wing "I Cry Ou...
Reviews.Content: Just like the previous reviewer I just got this camera today so I can't give it a full detailed review. I was gonna get the SX20is but they didn't have them in stock and I guess instead of looking for another store that would have it I just jumped at got this one cuz it's 35x zoom compared to the 20x zoom of the SX20is. The features are a similar such as Beach, Sunset, Snow, Fireworks, etc. I think the only mode the SX30is doesn't have that a SX20is has is Aquarium mode. But overall it takes really crisp and clear photos. I'll post some of my photos after I get the hang of the settings and camera modes. Overall I'm liking the camera. Just gotta make sure I keep a tight grip on my camera cuz it's pretty heavy compared to my previous pocket sized Casio Exlim. I'm always afraid I'll drop this camera. So one important tip when you buy this camera is always have the neck strapped on around your neck so if you do drop it it's safe from accidents. All and All I think this is a great camera and worthy of the price.

Reviews.Title: Bad Picture Quality
Reviews.Content: Pros: 35x optical zoom, good lcd, hot shoe for flashCons: Very very Poor quality picture, Focus issues, chromatic aberration in all pictures, lens distortion in wide angle.I have been using Canon IXUS for the last 8 years and just want to upgrade it to a better zoom camera. I trusted Canon and ordered it on the 1st day it was available in Amazon.  I am totally dissatisfied with this Camera due to very very poor Picture quality and focus issues.I think Canon didn't test this camera or they have very very bad Quality control department.I almost took morethan 100 pictures in automode and none of those pictures are good. My smartphone can take better pictures than this. In manual mode pictures are better but we didn't expect this in a point and shoot camera.Build quality of this camera is also bad. You can feel cheap plastic grip in this camera.For me picture quality matters than features..For 429$ this is 100% waste of money and I am going to return this to Amazon.Thanks to Amazon for their wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MO
Reviews.Content: This camera is outstanding!!  Very light weight and worth the money.  Will work for any level of photography experience.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Matt K
Reviews.Content: Very awesome camera for a good price.. Would recomend it to people.. Only downfall  is a lot of settings a little overwhelming for beginner camera folk...

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Luthful
Reviews.Content: Great camera for someone who want more than just regular P&S.; I just love it, have a lot more to learn.

Reviews.Title: The Zoom is Great!!!!
Reviews.Author: Suzanne C. Henderson "SH"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for the zoom feature and that is definitely 5 stars to me.  The few pictures I have taken are great.  I am still learning the functions of the camera.  I highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: Canon SX30IS
Reviews.Author: Nathalia
Reviews.Content: Comprei esse produto em dezembro para uso pessoal e superou minhas expectaivas!A câmera é excelente e faz fotos incriveis com seu zoom.Deixa um pouco a desejar em locais escuros, mas é um ótimo custo-beneficio.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX30IS
Reviews.Author: MR BIKE
Reviews.Content: POOR PICTURE QUALITY, MOSTLY DUE TO NOISE FROM "IS" AND "ISO". SETTING THE "ISO" TO ITS LOWEST-SETTING AND TURNING OFF THE "IS" AND USING A TRIPOD, HELPS. PICTURE QUALITY IS THAT OF MY WIFE'S CANON A3000IS A SUB-$100 POINT & SHOOT. IN FACT MY WIFE'S A3000IS HAS LESS NOISE THEN THE SX30IS. DIRECT ACCESS TO FUNCTIONS BY WAY OF BUTTONS HAS BEEN REPLACED BY A MAZE OF MENUS AND SUB-MENUS. CANON ADVERTISED THAT "THE CAMERA USES VCM (VOICE COIL MOTOR) FOR HIGH-SPEED, QUIET, ENERGY-EFFICIENT LENS MOVEMENT WITH PRECISE CONTROL." THERE IS NOTHING QUIET OR HIGH-SPEED ABOUT THE ZOOM. THE LENS MOVES BY LEAPS AND BOUNDS. THERE IS NO PRINTED MANUAL;THE MANUAL IS ON A CD. IF YOU WANT TO PRINT IT OUT, ON A NON-DUPLEX PRINTER, YOU WILL HAVE 196 PAGES OF 8-1/2X11 COPY. YOU WILL NEED A CAMERA BAG TO CARRY IT AROUND IN. PERSONALLY, I WOULD LOOK ELSEWERE FOR A GOOD CAMERA. TRY PANASONIC OR THE FUJI "FINEPIX S100FS". THE FUJI IS A 2-YEAR OLD MODEL BUT ITS GREAT.PS:SOME ARE ASKING $699.00 FOR THE FUJI. I WOULD AVOID THESE RETAILERS AND BUY ELSEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product!!!
Reviews.Author: Canonfan
Reviews.Content: This camera is simply AWESOME!!!I bought lenses too and they are really affordable to buy.Wide angle lens is really superb!All the lenses are compatible with this camera. Looks like DSLR

Reviews.Title: Camera was broken when I received it.
Reviews.Author: Eddie Golden
Reviews.Content: I received my new camera just in time to go on vacation.  I charged the battery with a smile on my face just waiting to bring the camera to life.  When I turned it on I get lens error camera shutting off.  I restart again and again but nothing works.  I call Canon and after waiting a long time I got tec support and they tried to help.  Nothing worked so they said I could send it in to be repaired.  He said I might try using compressed air around the lens body to see if it would work.  No it didn't.  Well I will have to wait a couple weeks to send it in to see what happens.  I do know my new camera will be sitting at home unable to take the pictures I was hoping for.  I can at least borrow my old camera from my daughter so I will get some pictures.  Sorry about the rambling but how do you review something that doesn't work when you first get it.  It looks good just no pictures.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD
Reviews.Author: Jose Luis Orozco Santiago "jazz man"
Reviews.Content: The camera it's very good, and the delivery service was excelent. the only thing i can complain its the belt, for such a good camera, the belt quality is low. its sticky and sucks (not literaly)sorry for my bad gramar, but im im form mexico ¡viva mexico!

Reviews.Title: Canon camera with 35X Zoom
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: The picture quality appears to be a little better with the Canon I5S.  Maybe the 35X zoom does not focus as well as the 10x Zoom.  Maybe I need to get more experience using it.The battery charger is an improvement when compared to having two sets of rechargeable double A batteries with a charger.

Reviews.Title: PLEASE!!! DO NOT PURCHASE!!!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Soto
Reviews.Content: This camera in not worth its price, a lot of bells and whistles but very poor quality: (a) My son plays volleyball, I took a lot a pictures in "sports" mode during a night game, not one of them came out good, NOT ONE!, (b) The video option sucks BIG TIME! If you ever seen an episode of Southpark that is exactly what you get. Every team player seemed like a Southpark 3D character in movement, there was a lot of "jumping" or "skipping" in the frames, just awful. As soon as I saw this I wasted no time and packed the camera to return it.  I made the decision and it was final.The camera has good features: a good zoom lens and focus option. But even for still pictures you will notice that curve figures are not smooth. For still pictures this camera is too expensive, you will be better with another option, the zoom lens does not justify its price considering the output it offers.I have a Canon A70 and I've been able to obtain better results. I was very excited with this camera. It was an anniversary gift and considering the price, BOOM! I returned the camera and I had to pay 15% stocking fee not to say the disappointment I caused to my wife. SAD STORY!Lesson Learned: ALWAYS BUY AT AMAZON!!!!

Reviews.Title: Just received - playing and figuring out
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I just got my camera today and I have read the manual and am playing around with it.  So far, I love it.  I am an amateur and with no aspirations of being anything other than a mom taking pics of her kids.  I look for zoom because I like to avoid interrupting my kids playing but still snap good shots.  This camera definitely allows for that.  I have found though that it is harder to get a steady shot at high zoom than previous cameras I have owned.  But, the pic quality is SUPER clear.  My only complaint is that I cannot find the buttons or settings for using the mini, fisheye, color extraction or poster options that the features on the website (canon) boast...not in the manual that I saw, unless I overlooked, and I am not well versed enough in Canon's menus yet (having been a Kodak owner for the past several years) to figure it out :(  All in all, I am glad I returned my Kodak z981 and pre-ordered this one.  Another $200 is going to be well worth it.  I can already tell!

Reviews.Title: FAKE PICTURES FOR ADVERTISING
Reviews.Author: Brian B. Faber
Reviews.Content: I AM THOROUGHLY DISGUSTED WITH THE FAKE PICTURES THAT THEY USE TO ADVERTISE THIS PRODUCT. TAKE THE SUNSET AT THE OCEAN FOR EXAMPLE. THAT IS A WINDOWS WALLPAPER. THE TOUCAN IS ALSO A  WALLPAPER. THERE WERE A FEW OTHERS AS WELL. DON'T SELL US LIES AMAZON. IM NOT STUPID. I LOVE CANON CAMERAS. BUT LYING TO PEOPLE TO SELL THERE MESS. I DON'T THINK SO. I GIVE THIS NEGATIVE 5 STARS. LIAR!

Reviews.Title: Excelente Camara
Reviews.Author: Rontap
Reviews.Content: For those who speak spanishUna excelente cámara, se las recomiendo, es muy buena para esos que estamos aprendiendo ya que no están difícil de usar como lo es una profesional, el zoom de 35x es de lo mejor, el mismo lente ayuda a acoplarse lo que hace mas fácil las tomas de lejos, cuando digo el precio la gente se impresiona, estoy me contento con la camara, realmente recomendada. Yo personalmente hago muchas compras y nunca hago reviews pero esta vez saque tiempo por que realmente es necesario

Reviews.Title: Compatibility Issue
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Moving the memory card from SX30 to SX10, I noticed that the videos taken by SX30 on the same memory card earlier became not visible on SX10???In addition, I can only download the pictures and videos taken by SX10 to iPad.  In the same memory card, the pictures and videos taken by SX30 can not be download to iPad.Is the SX30 using different data format or different size???

Reviews.Title: Capture your memories
Reviews.Author: Prasanna "Prasanna - The Trojan"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. Zoom is excellent, it is a good compromise between 'point-n-shoot' cameras and 'digital SLR'. The best feature i like about it- LCD display rotates- The batteries are standard AA batteries, so if i run out of batteries, i can easily replace them (unlike having to wait to charge the custom batteries in most other point-n-shoot cameras"- several digitalSLR like feature- Very good zoom with Image stabilization.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I ever owned
Reviews.Author: rking
Reviews.Content: I have owned numerous cameras Leicas,Hasselblads Nikon,Rolliflex and this is the worst I havw ever had. I consider its performance worthless.

Reviews.Title: Returning the Canon SX30IS
Reviews.Author: James A. Cunningham
Reviews.Content: When I ordered the Canon SX30IS, what I really wanted was an SLR that could also take video. This camera does not well serve that goal. It's realy a point and shoot in the shape of an small SLR. For my large hands, it's too small to avoid activating some of the tiny buttons. But I could have lived with that. What I found unacceptable was the software. Unless you install the Canon program you can't get any images into a modern Apple computer. Upon installing it I found it a nightmare. It's almost impossible to get an image file into iPhoto or iMovie. If you use an Apple, forget it. I sent it back to Amazon.com, and in their usual trustworthy and easy to work with fashion, gave me a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Awresome
Reviews.Author: Ninja Masta "Hootowl Ninja"
Reviews.Content: Wow this Camera is awesome! Here i thought i was ordering some average  old camera and when it came inb the mail BOOYA not the one i ordered. So how does this happen? I know how. Some wierd pug looking woman who is too busy complaining about other employees picks the wrong box, then it heads on over to a sorter who gets confused and decides to just leave it setting on a table. From there it heads on over to someone who is supposed to figure out why its wrong but due to having RESTRICTIONS, they cant figure it out so lets just toss it on the line and send it anyway. This is the point where yet another person has a chance to fix it but hes being rushed that they need it for the truck and he says "uh huh huh huh huh huh....ok" and just sends it anyway. and THATS how i get the wrong product. Probably from hmmmmm CVG3?

Reviews.Title: I have regretted
Reviews.Author: ersin
Reviews.Content: Camera I had bought this company is corrupt and alcoholic FEDEX shipping company had delivered to people in my street in the middle of my order ... able to find at the end of my researches. With the single word "regretted" the end of the rush of so much time and then telephone one did not say sorry.

35x wide-angle optical zoom (24-840mm) with Optical Image Stabilizer
Improvements to Movie modes: use the Optical Image Stabilizer in the wide-angle setting;Optical Zoom is now available while shooting video
720p HD video with stereo sound; HDMI output
New Zoom Framing Assist button; DIGIC 4 Image Processor and 14.1 megapixels
Capture images and video to SD/SDHC/SDXC memory card, MultiMediaCard, MMC Plus Card, HC MMC Plus Card (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Canon SX30IS 14.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 Inch Wide LCD
